<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob" />

Node.js versus Next.js - A React Approach

Interview

<a href="https://bryan-guner.gitbook.io/my-docs/v/mynotes/interview/question-set-1" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1awozwy r-42olwf r-rs99b7 r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-15ysp7h r-ymttw5 r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"></a>

Question Set #1:

<a href="https://www.gitbook.com/?utm_source=content&amp;utm_medium=trademark&amp;utm_campaign=-MWyt4j29ReMyImgcaO7" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1uwl36a r-z2wwpe r-1rasi3h r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-1fdo3w0 r-1mnahxq r-ymttw5 r-5njf8e r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-eu3ka r-1aockid" /></a>

Powered By <span class="css-901oao css-16my406 r-b88u0q">GitBook</span>

Components And Props

# 

<span key="61bbd69b6ee544d7ad64cb97e4ef7a1b"><span offset-key="61bbd69b6ee544d7ad64cb97e4ef7a1b:0">Components and Props</span></span>

<span key="3da460950e7549a5adaae00f7a5a8635"><span offset-key="3da460950e7549a5adaae00f7a5a8635:0">Components let you split the UI into independent, reusable pieces, and think about each piece in isolation. This page provides an introduction to the idea of components. You can find a </span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/docs/react-component.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ef1fd22c6fe443efb936d9de87e082c2" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-34290_259-34291-237__"><span data-key="8aeb3dd199ea4cf895d4183b014ba2b3"><span data-offset-key="8aeb3dd199ea4cf895d4183b014ba2b3:0">detailed component API reference here</span></span></span></a><span key="bf1ffc73416646f2a01c1e4f7b5ba96b"><span offset-key="bf1ffc73416646f2a01c1e4f7b5ba96b:0">.</span></span>

<span key="f28fb427f44245efae064a38699db502"><span offset-key="f28fb427f44245efae064a38699db502:0">Conceptually, components are like JavaScript functions. They accept arbitrary inputs (called “props”) and return React elements describing what should appear on the screen.</span></span>

## 

<span key="bd3497f206814036a3e2db1dc8dd492d"><span offset-key="bd3497f206814036a3e2db1dc8dd492d:0">Function and Class Components</span></span>

<span key="76c2d8dfdfe1458c87ee74a315facd21"><span offset-key="76c2d8dfdfe1458c87ee74a315facd21:0">The simplest way to define a component is to write a JavaScript function:</span></span>

1

<span key="c58548746ce14835b538c4c996de50ce"><span offset-key="c58548746ce14835b538c4c996de50ce:0">function Welcome(props) {</span></span>

2

<span key="0d362cfddbe64a259c1f41f79eb577fe"><span offset-key="0d362cfddbe64a259c1f41f79eb577fe:0"> return &lt;h1>Hello, {props.name}&lt;/h1>;</span></span>

3

<span key="e3cbecfbe1084056a5df3fe660c3726d"><span offset-key="e3cbecfbe1084056a5df3fe660c3726d:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7" />

Copied!

<span key="40f9e6fc23874990a73b8d7487706374"><span offset-key="40f9e6fc23874990a73b8d7487706374:0">This function is a valid React component because it accepts a single “props” (which stands for properties) object argument with data and returns a React element. We call such components “function components” because they are literally JavaScript functions.</span></span>

<span key="4a06079b43bc40d693e6e0eb6517352e"><span offset-key="4a06079b43bc40d693e6e0eb6517352e:0">You can also use an </span></span><a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Classes" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="7955e0ef1b3e46c3990694d9a1a08456" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-34290_259-34291-237__"><span data-key="3d715c9216c2484d91c5de32e99d780e"><span data-offset-key="3d715c9216c2484d91c5de32e99d780e:0">ES6 class</span></span></span></a><span key="4c01402b81874d9cb3cd3632f898252f"><span offset-key="4c01402b81874d9cb3cd3632f898252f:0"> to define a component:</span></span>

1

<span key="d58c1ccc7aa54f9ab7d047bdfdf20696"><span offset-key="d58c1ccc7aa54f9ab7d047bdfdf20696:0">class Welcome extends React.Component {</span></span>

2

<span key="2ca814eb57ae43e39da2b7fc7fddd6df"><span offset-key="2ca814eb57ae43e39da2b7fc7fddd6df:0"> render() {</span></span>

3

<span key="44cf58eec50b45d19e72253d54e68e09"><span offset-key="44cf58eec50b45d19e72253d54e68e09:0"> return &lt;h1>Hello, {this.props.name}&lt;/h1>;</span></span>

4

<span key="cf210dc3f6254a7ba13cd3cddb0b12ec"><span offset-key="cf210dc3f6254a7ba13cd3cddb0b12ec:0"> }</span></span>

5

<span key="f5ed68798ca1467d82a0bfd736b14432"><span offset-key="f5ed68798ca1467d82a0bfd736b14432:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="33b46b95ceb843668bdf1936f1c5da4a"><span offset-key="33b46b95ceb843668bdf1936f1c5da4a:0">The above two components are equivalent from React’s point of view.</span></span>

<span key="e2c152576fd9422c846e9b516728be08"><span offset-key="e2c152576fd9422c846e9b516728be08:0">Function and Class components both have some additional features that we will discuss in the </span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/docs/state-and-lifecycle.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="b98fa8f2ac57448eaa56cf0749749999" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-34290_259-34291-237__"><span data-key="770cfb80d7a14dde873d22db92bd176b"><span data-offset-key="770cfb80d7a14dde873d22db92bd176b:0">next sections</span></span></span></a><span key="537104e01e134a6abba09fd0254365bc"><span offset-key="537104e01e134a6abba09fd0254365bc:0">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="7f65277f749d4a29b8b98f331167ba6d"><span offset-key="7f65277f749d4a29b8b98f331167ba6d:0">Rendering a Component</span></span>

<span key="2d6fd7d6ea844195a1da3b0246621db0"><span offset-key="2d6fd7d6ea844195a1da3b0246621db0:0">Previously, we only encountered React elements that represent DOM tags:</span></span>

1

<span key="8b5c98e9d3dd41a88d4f872511825afe"><span offset-key="8b5c98e9d3dd41a88d4f872511825afe:0">const element = &lt;div />;</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="e5faf142caff41b9a384f0577d4e0e45"><span offset-key="e5faf142caff41b9a384f0577d4e0e45:0">However, elements can also represent user-defined components:</span></span>

1

<span key="e4b9618cc83a4a58bed675c6126f25c9"><span offset-key="e4b9618cc83a4a58bed675c6126f25c9:0">const element = &lt;Welcome name="Sara" />;</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="aae9aee24908445e912d40e4eaec1503"><span offset-key="aae9aee24908445e912d40e4eaec1503:0">When React sees an element representing a user-defined component, it passes JSX attributes and children to this component as a single object. We call this object “props”.</span></span>

<span key="1035de2f15924738a7db66fb535977ae"><span offset-key="1035de2f15924738a7db66fb535977ae:0">For example, this code renders “Hello, Sara” on the page:</span></span>

1

<span key="ca1756902cab4aa8bbcd08af3030554e"><span offset-key="ca1756902cab4aa8bbcd08af3030554e:0">function Welcome(props) { return &lt;h1>Hello, {props.name}&lt;/h1>;</span></span>

2

<span key="f13ef330ecad4d0f8edc00569f9fd18c"><span offset-key="f13ef330ecad4d0f8edc00569f9fd18c:0">}</span></span>

3

<span key="30f4f2d6f8194af998ad611a2e65c4fe"><span offset-key="30f4f2d6f8194af998ad611a2e65c4fe:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

4

<span key="4a44fefe9efc4b0088cc2155de6a19c1"><span offset-key="4a44fefe9efc4b0088cc2155de6a19c1:0">const element = &lt;Welcome name="Sara" />;ReactDOM.render(</span></span>

5

<span key="c731aec0393444f79ff505f5414f8f29"><span offset-key="c731aec0393444f79ff505f5414f8f29:0"> element,</span></span>

6

<span key="a1c81cc0c04a4143937ad55155d0183b"><span offset-key="a1c81cc0c04a4143937ad55155d0183b:0"> document.getElementById('root')</span></span>

7

<span key="c3d3c5e027c04f9abc34daa0f1947cd1"><span offset-key="c3d3c5e027c04f9abc34daa0f1947cd1:0">);</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="7ea24e66b02c4021949c241321bb4b78"><span offset-key="7ea24e66b02c4021949c241321bb4b78:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/redirect-to-codepen/components-and-props/rendering-a-component" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="4982e79d865542f19d6e3700799fb122" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-34290_259-34291-237__"><span data-key="ea8e7ea012b44a0aa199395faa616fa7"><strong>Try it on CodePen</strong></span></span></a><span key="74e3425446504192ae34a1bffa67e45b"><span offset-key="74e3425446504192ae34a1bffa67e45b:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="b542c76354154d249a6a9b4df4cd15cf"><span offset-key="b542c76354154d249a6a9b4df4cd15cf:0">Let’s recap what happens in this example:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="0e0588425a9a4eed9afb7c21e080b6f5"><span offset-key="0e0588425a9a4eed9afb7c21e080b6f5:0">We call </span>`ReactDOM.render()`<span offset-key="0e0588425a9a4eed9afb7c21e080b6f5:2"> with the </span>`<Welcome name="Sara" />`<span offset-key="0e0588425a9a4eed9afb7c21e080b6f5:4"> element.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="1685636ae425493ba63d66c2b6904505"><span offset-key="1685636ae425493ba63d66c2b6904505:0">React calls the </span>`Welcome`<span offset-key="1685636ae425493ba63d66c2b6904505:2"> component with </span>`{name: 'Sara'}`<span offset-key="1685636ae425493ba63d66c2b6904505:4"> as the props.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="df869815789542c68e75f10984f3e688"><span offset-key="df869815789542c68e75f10984f3e688:0">Our </span>`Welcome`<span offset-key="df869815789542c68e75f10984f3e688:2"> component returns a </span>`<h1>Hello, Sara</h1>`<span offset-key="df869815789542c68e75f10984f3e688:4"> element as the result.</span></span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">4.</span>
    <span key="ec0b5f79b2824ff5abd3ad7773e1eceb"><span offset-key="ec0b5f79b2824ff5abd3ad7773e1eceb:0">React DOM efficiently updates the DOM to match </span>`<h1>Hello, Sara</h1>`<span offset-key="ec0b5f79b2824ff5abd3ad7773e1eceb:2">.</span></span>

> <span key="527c940ba99d4c71a83711d851c25617">**Note:**<span offset-key="527c940ba99d4c71a83711d851c25617:1"> Always start component names with a capital letter.</span></span>
>
> <span key="840131517dae45ee8a164109bc52c30c"><span offset-key="840131517dae45ee8a164109bc52c30c:0">React treats components starting with lowercase letters as DOM tags. For example, </span>`<div />`<span offset-key="840131517dae45ee8a164109bc52c30c:2"> represents an HTML div tag, but </span>`<Welcome />`<span offset-key="840131517dae45ee8a164109bc52c30c:4"> represents a component and requires </span>`Welcome`<span offset-key="840131517dae45ee8a164109bc52c30c:6"> to be in scope.</span></span>
>
> <span key="356999122de9498bb94ecbc9c5610d45"><span offset-key="356999122de9498bb94ecbc9c5610d45:0">To learn more about the reasoning behind this convention, please read </span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/docs/jsx-in-depth.html#user-defined-components-must-be-capitalized" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="dcce44d77a3247fea266b23117c07290" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-34290_259-34291-237__"><span data-key="421d4c4811c140eda27519d8823b4275"><span data-offset-key="421d4c4811c140eda27519d8823b4275:0">JSX In Depth</span></span></span></a><span key="8fdf011c06d04cdfada6b6150f36bd50"><span offset-key="8fdf011c06d04cdfada6b6150f36bd50:0">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="438c2d8b3b234103ad3b861dcdecb3ae"><span offset-key="438c2d8b3b234103ad3b861dcdecb3ae:0">Composing Components</span></span>

<span key="b448c876f8c748c0a0d100615b135c05"><span offset-key="b448c876f8c748c0a0d100615b135c05:0">Components can refer to other components in their output. This lets us use the same component abstraction for any level of detail. A button, a form, a dialog, a screen: in React apps, all those are commonly expressed as components.</span></span>

<span key="25007ca98e4541d58dc1da04626d3d32"><span offset-key="25007ca98e4541d58dc1da04626d3d32:0">For example, we can create an </span>`App`<span offset-key="25007ca98e4541d58dc1da04626d3d32:2"> component that renders </span>`Welcome`<span offset-key="25007ca98e4541d58dc1da04626d3d32:4"> many times:</span></span>

1

<span key="c5b91330c6ed42d89993ab7d2fe918e6"><span offset-key="c5b91330c6ed42d89993ab7d2fe918e6:0">function Welcome(props) {</span></span>

2

<span key="051204632fd6402b9135769a921a6250"><span offset-key="051204632fd6402b9135769a921a6250:0"> return &lt;h1>Hello, {props.name}&lt;/h1>;</span></span>

3

<span key="93d33ec1482148b5b28a23918c2773cc"><span offset-key="93d33ec1482148b5b28a23918c2773cc:0">}</span></span>

4

<span key="3c7dbe8b146d4a74881072f6f6c87457"><span offset-key="3c7dbe8b146d4a74881072f6f6c87457:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

5

<span key="cff39d7b2cb843e9a5edf129ae648cb7"><span offset-key="cff39d7b2cb843e9a5edf129ae648cb7:0">function App() {</span></span>

6

<span key="0d7835f6f5d246a6975605887feb55c9"><span offset-key="0d7835f6f5d246a6975605887feb55c9:0"> return (</span></span>

7

<span key="a236fe68435841cd8cc36c0ada07309e"><span offset-key="a236fe68435841cd8cc36c0ada07309e:0"> &lt;div></span></span>

8

<span key="b2f108423ab34ae3ac3af65579add8b1"><span offset-key="b2f108423ab34ae3ac3af65579add8b1:0"> &lt;Welcome name="Sara" /> &lt;Welcome name="Cahal" /> &lt;Welcome name="Edite" /> &lt;/div></span></span>

9

<span key="207b7b99ccd4404d82103136059c7e21"><span offset-key="207b7b99ccd4404d82103136059c7e21:0"> );</span></span>

10

<span key="950c5e78ccca4c5c885d166f165bfcc4"><span offset-key="950c5e78ccca4c5c885d166f165bfcc4:0">}</span></span>

11

<span key="277d08507bb846a4a52a0c8642e4ea60"><span offset-key="277d08507bb846a4a52a0c8642e4ea60:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

12

<span key="3ef0fcbd1b6948f4be5b642e124eb8c2"><span offset-key="3ef0fcbd1b6948f4be5b642e124eb8c2:0">ReactDOM.render(</span></span>

13

<span key="48a8f076712a4521b13a170a5b7e0406"><span offset-key="48a8f076712a4521b13a170a5b7e0406:0"> &lt;App />,</span></span>

14

<span key="fef2cd9ad5424d33942e754324fcef9d"><span offset-key="fef2cd9ad5424d33942e754324fcef9d:0"> document.getElementById('root')</span></span>

15

<span key="2eb43377d7014408a237c4d98eba0b98"><span offset-key="2eb43377d7014408a237c4d98eba0b98:0">);</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="8f415f4947944702907ee5901fd6705f"><span offset-key="8f415f4947944702907ee5901fd6705f:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/redirect-to-codepen/components-and-props/composing-components" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="0dab53260d7a4804b89b8931b54a6ec7" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-34290_259-34291-237__"><span data-key="cdcd05f77067406fa1857820d8e9a927"><strong>Try it on CodePen</strong></span></span></a><span key="d77dd01b4af4462ca78b88692deaaac4"><span offset-key="d77dd01b4af4462ca78b88692deaaac4:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="2cb91b3bf2214399902e483e952e4d69"><span offset-key="2cb91b3bf2214399902e483e952e4d69:0">Typically, new React apps have a single </span>`App`<span offset-key="2cb91b3bf2214399902e483e952e4d69:2"> component at the very top. However, if you integrate React into an existing app, you might start bottom-up with a small component like </span>`Button`<span offset-key="2cb91b3bf2214399902e483e952e4d69:4"> and gradually work your way to the top of the view hierarchy.</span></span>

## 

<span key="bd767651d8ed40df96b67b99953da373"><span offset-key="bd767651d8ed40df96b67b99953da373:0">Extracting Components</span></span>

<span key="09856974a3cc47f2ab3b9ac8860ac77b"><span offset-key="09856974a3cc47f2ab3b9ac8860ac77b:0">Don’t be afraid to split components into smaller components.</span></span>

<span key="24d58b2d48e64389bca4070fb7ea5426"><span offset-key="24d58b2d48e64389bca4070fb7ea5426:0">For example, consider this </span>`Comment`<span offset-key="24d58b2d48e64389bca4070fb7ea5426:2"> component:</span></span>

1

<span key="40d8ee98e3d6431f91fbd1b00741630a"><span offset-key="40d8ee98e3d6431f91fbd1b00741630a:0">function Comment(props) {</span></span>

2

<span key="926eff0c49714fd1b0654cc1df8ad6c7"><span offset-key="926eff0c49714fd1b0654cc1df8ad6c7:0"> return (</span></span>

3

<span key="3969994f52d5447f890eafbed696313f"><span offset-key="3969994f52d5447f890eafbed696313f:0"> &lt;div className="Comment"></span></span>

4

<span key="590c438071e4485ebcd3681503bbd03d"><span offset-key="590c438071e4485ebcd3681503bbd03d:0"> &lt;div className="UserInfo"></span></span>

5

<span key="36486aeeea034d2e932217232aa54a35"><span offset-key="36486aeeea034d2e932217232aa54a35:0"> &lt;img className="Avatar"</span></span>

6

<span key="288f7f1f2e1d40d8ab23ab1eafa23327"><span offset-key="288f7f1f2e1d40d8ab23ab1eafa23327:0"> src={props.author.avatarUrl}</span></span>

7

<span key="d51c7492999944b48d31fd4c62a3caef"><span offset-key="d51c7492999944b48d31fd4c62a3caef:0"> alt={props.author.name}</span></span>

8

<span key="ebf7329afc0d4853bec713a348c9fd14"><span offset-key="ebf7329afc0d4853bec713a348c9fd14:0"> /></span></span>

9

<span key="ec9a49f0020041969adb03465b03c190"><span offset-key="ec9a49f0020041969adb03465b03c190:0"> &lt;div className="UserInfo-name"></span></span>

10

<span key="926a641093ea4b1a8d63de3a60a31e19"><span offset-key="926a641093ea4b1a8d63de3a60a31e19:0"> {props.author.name}</span></span>

11

<span key="61637cb08eda4adda371be006ef9a43f"><span offset-key="61637cb08eda4adda371be006ef9a43f:0"> &lt;/div></span></span>

12

<span key="9f22a428ae32424f8d9eff3164462474"><span offset-key="9f22a428ae32424f8d9eff3164462474:0"> &lt;/div></span></span>

13

<span key="59020a087aaa4ec48365d3c3748d2086"><span offset-key="59020a087aaa4ec48365d3c3748d2086:0"> &lt;div className="Comment-text"></span></span>

14

<span key="d9e219db2a3f4a48abee081ac5d458eb"><span offset-key="d9e219db2a3f4a48abee081ac5d458eb:0"> {props.text}</span></span>

15

<span key="e414991a6115427a8d8b38d1e28dd1c8"><span offset-key="e414991a6115427a8d8b38d1e28dd1c8:0"> &lt;/div></span></span>

16

<span key="7bdfea2744f94c70a513880955113180"><span offset-key="7bdfea2744f94c70a513880955113180:0"> &lt;div className="Comment-date"></span></span>

17

<span key="196e3abd794b4119a152589fe24c39ea"><span offset-key="196e3abd794b4119a152589fe24c39ea:0"> {formatDate(props.date)}</span></span>

18

<span key="7604bb3a167e44cf8b8a37db380c1dcf"><span offset-key="7604bb3a167e44cf8b8a37db380c1dcf:0"> &lt;/div></span></span>

19

<span key="10a90ca73c314a05b50cfee152ebe94b"><span offset-key="10a90ca73c314a05b50cfee152ebe94b:0"> &lt;/div></span></span>

20

<span key="6308c88dce8f47a89a08ee70032243bc"><span offset-key="6308c88dce8f47a89a08ee70032243bc:0"> );</span></span>

21

<span key="6eec4747698a40bba05a5f17d41463a4"><span offset-key="6eec4747698a40bba05a5f17d41463a4:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="a25c664758c149c0b0fbe0e40aea9e5c"><span offset-key="a25c664758c149c0b0fbe0e40aea9e5c:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/redirect-to-codepen/components-and-props/extracting-components" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e244164f8bae4b2da4f89558260b445f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-34290_259-34291-237__"><span data-key="e63c353be2f44422ad7df757f8f102c7"><strong>Try it on CodePen</strong></span></span></a><span key="8c9a9a87c6ad400488651dc2ee681e43"><span offset-key="8c9a9a87c6ad400488651dc2ee681e43:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="53f1d2b730434c2ea5983326d3190362"><span offset-key="53f1d2b730434c2ea5983326d3190362:0">It accepts </span>`author`<span offset-key="53f1d2b730434c2ea5983326d3190362:2"> (an object), </span>`text`<span offset-key="53f1d2b730434c2ea5983326d3190362:4"> (a string), and </span>`date`<span offset-key="53f1d2b730434c2ea5983326d3190362:6"> (a date) as props, and describes a comment on a social media website.</span></span>

<span key="a89531586f864d9a9081e771f2070f58"><span offset-key="a89531586f864d9a9081e771f2070f58:0">This component can be tricky to change because of all the nesting, and it is also hard to reuse individual parts of it. Let’s extract a few components from it.</span></span>

<span key="c8612e1870a64c9d81fd2d876b43a591"><span offset-key="c8612e1870a64c9d81fd2d876b43a591:0">First, we will extract </span>`Avatar`<span offset-key="c8612e1870a64c9d81fd2d876b43a591:2">:</span></span>

1

<span key="16b08e2faa01477087bcfff6cf7e47cf"><span offset-key="16b08e2faa01477087bcfff6cf7e47cf:0">function Avatar(props) {</span></span>

2

<span key="7e6058cb12ca467a9e9d98961c693303"><span offset-key="7e6058cb12ca467a9e9d98961c693303:0"> return (</span></span>

3

<span key="23034acfa78d4524abc308f4116aaccc"><span offset-key="23034acfa78d4524abc308f4116aaccc:0"> &lt;img className="Avatar" src={props.user.avatarUrl} alt={props.user.name} /> );</span></span>

4

<span key="fb4b3f1d4fd949b2ad9b1dc639607ea6"><span offset-key="fb4b3f1d4fd949b2ad9b1dc639607ea6:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="14a649a9655a498ba0098b635fbf06f9"><span offset-key="14a649a9655a498ba0098b635fbf06f9:0">The </span>`Avatar`<span offset-key="14a649a9655a498ba0098b635fbf06f9:2"> doesn’t need to know that it is being rendered inside a </span>`Comment`<span offset-key="14a649a9655a498ba0098b635fbf06f9:4">. This is why we have given its prop a more generic name: </span>`user`<span offset-key="14a649a9655a498ba0098b635fbf06f9:6"> rather than </span>`author`<span offset-key="14a649a9655a498ba0098b635fbf06f9:8">.</span></span>

<span key="522a5aa5778a447eab1d54c476ffd8ff"><span offset-key="522a5aa5778a447eab1d54c476ffd8ff:0">We recommend naming props from the component’s own point of view rather than the context in which it is being used.</span></span>

<span key="acb78a60a973470994ab7bf80e90e4d1"><span offset-key="acb78a60a973470994ab7bf80e90e4d1:0">We can now simplify </span>`Comment`<span offset-key="acb78a60a973470994ab7bf80e90e4d1:2"> a tiny bit:</span></span>

1

<span key="06278a5749c143ed99840187cfd9c75e"><span offset-key="06278a5749c143ed99840187cfd9c75e:0">function Comment(props) {</span></span>

2

<span key="648526f3e1504ef88b1ce0dadcdc689a"><span offset-key="648526f3e1504ef88b1ce0dadcdc689a:0"> return (</span></span>

3

<span key="75832beeb31946928fe42f084a855585"><span offset-key="75832beeb31946928fe42f084a855585:0"> &lt;div className="Comment"></span></span>

4

<span key="3f56dd64626e404fb81386b178b85ce2"><span offset-key="3f56dd64626e404fb81386b178b85ce2:0"> &lt;div className="UserInfo"></span></span>

5

<span key="da402eaa97f043f3933c4e6ca5d3aea0"><span offset-key="da402eaa97f043f3933c4e6ca5d3aea0:0"> &lt;Avatar user={props.author} /> &lt;div className="UserInfo-name"></span></span>

6

<span key="524d9c846250426c9fdb1cfd668a5c50"><span offset-key="524d9c846250426c9fdb1cfd668a5c50:0"> {props.author.name}</span></span>

7

<span key="d00fec6df07e48b7aaf330f416e41f00"><span offset-key="d00fec6df07e48b7aaf330f416e41f00:0"> &lt;/div></span></span>

8

<span key="11fb7e9b9096421a9e91ec20e18fe1ad"><span offset-key="11fb7e9b9096421a9e91ec20e18fe1ad:0"> &lt;/div></span></span>

9

<span key="f69899a7f5ea4178a0bdb5f881ca7f8c"><span offset-key="f69899a7f5ea4178a0bdb5f881ca7f8c:0"> &lt;div className="Comment-text"></span></span>

10

<span key="922793a54da54dafa2ebee62b57851f8"><span offset-key="922793a54da54dafa2ebee62b57851f8:0"> {props.text}</span></span>

11

<span key="d9d2b44d62a543fb81617c2f519b16d3"><span offset-key="d9d2b44d62a543fb81617c2f519b16d3:0"> &lt;/div></span></span>

12

<span key="e1c4ed66e6b24f53a673edbfb9114c85"><span offset-key="e1c4ed66e6b24f53a673edbfb9114c85:0"> &lt;div className="Comment-date"></span></span>

13

<span key="b8ac3468ffd246b5b6aae0aebb5dc918"><span offset-key="b8ac3468ffd246b5b6aae0aebb5dc918:0"> {formatDate(props.date)}</span></span>

14

<span key="87f66d4e53c5494a8963eb046104637a"><span offset-key="87f66d4e53c5494a8963eb046104637a:0"> &lt;/div></span></span>

15

<span key="7cc497f2130d4d108a507d48275e79f5"><span offset-key="7cc497f2130d4d108a507d48275e79f5:0"> &lt;/div></span></span>

16

<span key="cb4866d5cfe54748b4943a1d2b6138ba"><span offset-key="cb4866d5cfe54748b4943a1d2b6138ba:0"> );</span></span>

17

<span key="329c2eb040834693a28dffa4bc8cb763"><span offset-key="329c2eb040834693a28dffa4bc8cb763:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="a24ed665d9d24162b06f1e619ca3e2f1"><span offset-key="a24ed665d9d24162b06f1e619ca3e2f1:0">Next, we will extract a </span>`UserInfo`<span offset-key="a24ed665d9d24162b06f1e619ca3e2f1:2"> component that renders an </span>`Avatar`<span offset-key="a24ed665d9d24162b06f1e619ca3e2f1:4"> next to the user’s name:</span></span>

1

<span key="2869c871859d4da6a848b1a4cf6b7501"><span offset-key="2869c871859d4da6a848b1a4cf6b7501:0">function UserInfo(props) {</span></span>

2

<span key="696a124c33a94b00bcf77537007c25b1"><span offset-key="696a124c33a94b00bcf77537007c25b1:0"> return (</span></span>

3

<span key="dd8681ce140f4cb191766e0ca2d4f093"><span offset-key="dd8681ce140f4cb191766e0ca2d4f093:0"> &lt;div className="UserInfo"> &lt;Avatar user={props.user} /> &lt;div className="UserInfo-name"> {props.user.name} &lt;/div> &lt;/div> );</span></span>

4

<span key="56bbfaa6d38e4d1683b3bdc87872e723"><span offset-key="56bbfaa6d38e4d1683b3bdc87872e723:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="c2a100c9a398486c85a0dfb755097b5d"><span offset-key="c2a100c9a398486c85a0dfb755097b5d:0">This lets us simplify </span>`Comment`<span offset-key="c2a100c9a398486c85a0dfb755097b5d:2"> even further:</span></span>

1

<span key="d28ea065d4854d88906fb80b1b29bc81"><span offset-key="d28ea065d4854d88906fb80b1b29bc81:0">function Comment(props) {</span></span>

2

<span key="1dae1030a7e1450b8d23ae7498b69667"><span offset-key="1dae1030a7e1450b8d23ae7498b69667:0"> return (</span></span>

3

<span key="26e4ec7300554d269b9414827a4de535"><span offset-key="26e4ec7300554d269b9414827a4de535:0"> &lt;div className="Comment"></span></span>

4

<span key="92ac74b978724c29ba6a92a56da9233a"><span offset-key="92ac74b978724c29ba6a92a56da9233a:0"> &lt;UserInfo user={props.author} /> &lt;div className="Comment-text"></span></span>

5

<span key="3aa887bc73d04ba59cb8b1d24d52f26e"><span offset-key="3aa887bc73d04ba59cb8b1d24d52f26e:0"> {props.text}</span></span>

6

<span key="b185c1230cb7462da2868580ac47b7b5"><span offset-key="b185c1230cb7462da2868580ac47b7b5:0"> &lt;/div></span></span>

7

<span key="f877341ef2bc4613b4b1f04ace7eab13"><span offset-key="f877341ef2bc4613b4b1f04ace7eab13:0"> &lt;div className="Comment-date"></span></span>

8

<span key="50a9f9c556d040cf96d51e2be8909208"><span offset-key="50a9f9c556d040cf96d51e2be8909208:0"> {formatDate(props.date)}</span></span>

9

<span key="13f3a03613f04d1c9af1105839970b14"><span offset-key="13f3a03613f04d1c9af1105839970b14:0"> &lt;/div></span></span>

10

<span key="4ccaf321bc8d4164a39b42329bdc2a14"><span offset-key="4ccaf321bc8d4164a39b42329bdc2a14:0"> &lt;/div></span></span>

11

<span key="facca7aac1d9435caae6bf3a4078a0ad"><span offset-key="facca7aac1d9435caae6bf3a4078a0ad:0"> );</span></span>

12

<span key="ee27b7a907944eee8a90525707e0e9bb"><span offset-key="ee27b7a907944eee8a90525707e0e9bb:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="7d70f1a6c4ab4e81859c88c92162fa93"><span offset-key="7d70f1a6c4ab4e81859c88c92162fa93:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/redirect-to-codepen/components-and-props/extracting-components-continued" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6c386a9e7d044d9ebc41c71fa60aefbb" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-34290_259-34291-237__"><span data-key="486a72e6a7e64bf5b7f6f40f12055fa1"><strong>Try it on CodePen</strong></span></span></a><span key="ecbd2014f7f04cd3be12fa4f35697240"><span offset-key="ecbd2014f7f04cd3be12fa4f35697240:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="6e151ebad0694b4eb47ab1bf00a903c9"><span offset-key="6e151ebad0694b4eb47ab1bf00a903c9:0">Extracting components might seem like grunt work at first, but having a palette of reusable components pays off in larger apps. A good rule of thumb is that if a part of your UI is used several times (</span>`Button`<span offset-key="6e151ebad0694b4eb47ab1bf00a903c9:2">, </span>`Panel`<span offset-key="6e151ebad0694b4eb47ab1bf00a903c9:4">, </span>`Avatar`<span offset-key="6e151ebad0694b4eb47ab1bf00a903c9:6">), or is complex enough on its own (</span>`App`<span offset-key="6e151ebad0694b4eb47ab1bf00a903c9:8">, </span>`FeedStory`<span offset-key="6e151ebad0694b4eb47ab1bf00a903c9:10">, </span>`Comment`<span offset-key="6e151ebad0694b4eb47ab1bf00a903c9:12">), it is a good candidate to be extracted to a separate component.</span></span>

## 

<span key="f3285ca04ac84976b3123f9a64c3efa5"><span offset-key="f3285ca04ac84976b3123f9a64c3efa5:0">Props are Read-Only</span></span>

<span key="121390f6f29844d8b5c4885999a35b20"><span offset-key="121390f6f29844d8b5c4885999a35b20:0">Whether you declare a component </span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/docs/components-and-props.html#function-and-class-components" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e3d2ab153bf0475e89bb5199b4e292d6" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-34290_259-34291-237__"><span data-key="3b77738d9d5d4fbfb20a3893c2109270"><span data-offset-key="3b77738d9d5d4fbfb20a3893c2109270:0">as a function or a class</span></span></span></a><span key="34c907da205a43a88af73bace854aa15"><span offset-key="34c907da205a43a88af73bace854aa15:0">, it must never modify its own props. Consider this </span>`sum`<span offset-key="34c907da205a43a88af73bace854aa15:2"> function:</span></span>

1

<span key="7ba4273391ef4f2ea0ad90cd3d2519f7"><span offset-key="7ba4273391ef4f2ea0ad90cd3d2519f7:0">function sum(a, b) {</span></span>

2

<span key="8f2e0480b35849bc9dd9324698962696"><span offset-key="8f2e0480b35849bc9dd9324698962696:0"> return a + b;</span></span>

3

<span key="49d69a1a1e2d4ab99ee469c873a688c0"><span offset-key="49d69a1a1e2d4ab99ee469c873a688c0:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="7a029cff7c1e4ee6be9a98542dbd765f"><span offset-key="7a029cff7c1e4ee6be9a98542dbd765f:0">Such functions are called </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pure_function" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a1d648eba1e3401d805f0caec46a10af" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-34290_259-34291-237__"><span data-key="8fe01bc7e6d047b9a13675bebd342359"><span data-offset-key="8fe01bc7e6d047b9a13675bebd342359:0">“pure”</span></span></span></a><span key="7f4664d03d8b428b83f4f7fa5b0a1e45"><span offset-key="7f4664d03d8b428b83f4f7fa5b0a1e45:0"> because they do not attempt to change their inputs, and always return the same result for the same inputs.</span></span>

<span key="027e769b9ead4d82bebcec33fdd3c22d"><span offset-key="027e769b9ead4d82bebcec33fdd3c22d:0">In contrast, this function is impure because it changes its own input:</span></span>

1

<span key="9f5143f9ab7b479a9dd4a4b7b148b0e8"><span offset-key="9f5143f9ab7b479a9dd4a4b7b148b0e8:0">function withdraw(account, amount) {</span></span>

2

<span key="604c666fb0e241d783122a3f91aa12d6"><span offset-key="604c666fb0e241d783122a3f91aa12d6:0"> account.total -= amount;</span></span>

3

<span key="2cb5062ccef749c7a0e9e10e51e561bd"><span offset-key="2cb5062ccef749c7a0e9e10e51e561bd:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="01a6b57386724635b24dd2a8ad5d7395"><span offset-key="01a6b57386724635b24dd2a8ad5d7395:0">React is pretty flexible but it has a single strict rule:</span></span>

<span key="f953ed8bf66b477799aa476f1e11b4c2">**All React components must act like pure functions with respect to their props.**</span>

<span key="15161d84f5de44e487a5198e18186285"><span offset-key="15161d84f5de44e487a5198e18186285:0">Of course, application UIs are dynamic and change over time. In the </span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/docs/state-and-lifecycle.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="beaca49a889d4bc5974fd845e769cbeb" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-34290_259-34291-237__"><span data-key="241336fe55c042228f6fd21abc9c5506"><span data-offset-key="241336fe55c042228f6fd21abc9c5506:0">next section</span></span></span></a><span key="90f80debf34b4a2cbf307d10af030b6b"><span offset-key="90f80debf34b4a2cbf307d10af030b6b:0">, we will introduce a new concept of “state”. State allows React components to change their output over time in response to user actions, network responses, and anything else, without violating this rule.</span></span>

<a href="hello-world.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1awozwy r-14lw9ot r-190qawg r-z2wwpe r-rs99b7 r-4dj0k7 r-1loqt21 r-1quu1zo r-1ro0kt6 r-18u37iz r-16y2uox r-1wbh5a2 r-nsbfu8 r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"></a>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1rasi3h r-1472mwg r-1vzi8xi r-lrsllp" />

Props are Read-Only
